alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Johnson County through 415 PM MDT... At 350 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Fort Reno Historical Site, or 21 miles northeast of Kaycee, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 280 and 287. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
